review_text: I had two choices in target - pay $129 for an identical coffee maker without an iced coffee button  or $169 for this one. I thought that it would brew at a different temperature, but it's identical to any other kind of brew process. You can do this with any keurig - you just fill a cup with ice, the "iced coffee or tea" brews hot and then is cooled down by the ice. What the iced button does it make it a "small" so that it fits in a cup with ice. However you do not need to spend any extra money on this feature and I am quite disappointed in Keurig for marketing it this way. The iced button is misleading, the marketing is misleading and that doesn't make me feel very good about my purchase. name: Kll799
review_text: I have now had four different Keurig models over the years.... and I haven t been overly dissapointed with the coffee. Granted, a k-cup coffee is never going to taste the same as an actual ground bean brewed cup....but....it has always been a good stand in. That being said, I really don t see any great changes to the actual coffee brewing features. There is the classic option to  strong  brew your coffee - although it never really seems any stronger to me.... The appearance of this machine is a bit different. The display area is at the top of the machine - which does make this a challenging brewer if you are planning to place it under a countertop. You must really open the top lever to insert the k cup and the controls are all on the top- if not purely for countertop use....this is a tough machine to use when placed on a counter under a cabinet. The main feature that really bugs me about this unit.....the digital functions. With today s technology, and the cost of this item...I would at least expect a touch screen or increased button option. The frustration of having to hit the same buttons multiple times to get the features you want - or set up features....it reminds me of an old digital alarm clock....when you accidentally scroll past your alarm time and have to cycle through the whole am/pm to get back to the start. The brushed steel look is an attractive feature and wipes off well. Overall, this machine does seem a lot more dense and heavy than the others... the setup instructions are somewhat frustrating. Upon opening, I really just wanted a cup of coffee....not to have to scroll through endless digital menus in order to actual use all of the features. I m not quite sure why they are advertising this product for iced coffee - as it brew no differently than any other Keurig brewer. I don t particularly need instructions to tell me to  brew over ice  for an iced coffee. Overall, this is a Keurig brewer, which brews Keurig quality coffee....just nothing really cutting edge or unique that would make me want to spend the extra money for the  new  model.
review_title: Delivers quality Keurig expected coffee....could use a couple design improvements

review_text: So far, so good...can't speak for longevity. This "K-Elite" replaces a B60 Special Edition that was still working after almost 8 years of usage. The only reason I bought the K-Elite is I couldn't pass up the Prime Day deal and decided that we would shelve the B60 as a backup. We really like this new machine compared to the old one...1) ever so slightly shorter which helps with cabinets with bottom molding (our B60 had to be shoved in further as to not hit molding with the pod handle), 2) MUCH quieter than the B60 "Quiet Brew", the B60 would sound like it was taking off from the airport, 3) a couple of more cup size options, 4) larger water tank means less weekly fill ups, 5) a nicer display and a nice light for water tank which does surprisingly help you see level at 4am, 6) strong brew actually works!! (for those of us who want a nice wake up cup). About the only thing I can complain about is the design of the water tank. If you look quickly at the rear of the tank and use that as your top off guide you will have water all over the counter as I did the first time filling this. The FRONT of the tank is the limiting factor as it sits almost an inch lower than the back. Not a deal breaker by any stretch, and I won't deduct any stars for it, just something to be aware of and pass the word around to other household members. Not completely sure what the "hot water" function does...well, I know what it does, but I used to just run the B60 without a k-cup for that. Haven't tried the iced coffee setting, I'm not a fan, but the wife is. If it works well then it's just another feather in the cap of this brewer. All in all, completely satisfied and regard this as a great upgrade to the B60 Special Edition. Time will tell if it has the longevity that the B60 had. It does seem to be built pretty sturdy, but again, time will tell and we all know Keurig has had some bad apples out there.
review_title: Compared to B60 SE...it's a great upgrade!

name: Kospar
review_text: First of all, I think a lot of the bad reviews listed when looking up this newest K-Elite model, are not reviewing this model. One reviewer said he had it a year? It's only been out since Feb 2018. Just to be clear, I am reviewing the 2018 Keurig K-Elite brushed slate. My first Keurig was the K-Classic, and it lasted a whopping 6 years without a single problem! The following year it started leaking just a bit from the base about once a week or so. Still kept it, as it worked perfectly. I started looking for another Keurig, and saw a commercial for the K-Select. Looked nice on TV, so I went to the store to check it out. Well, it was not made nearly as sturdy as the Classic model I had. I thought it was very flimsy, and cheap looking. So on the shelf it stayed! I actually ended up buying a Nespresso Pixie, which makes great espresso, but not good if you want a nice hot cup of coffee! I kept checking Keurig off and on, to see if they came out with anything new. BINGO! The K-Elite! This is hands down the BEST Keurig yet! What I like, It's quiet, fast, simple to use, many cup sizes, dispenses a full cup of water without having to hold the button (unlike the bulky, ugly K575 we have at the office), the handle and metal plate are both of matte metal, and the plate is nice and thick, the handle opens smoothly, the lid comes off in one piece, it's beautifully finished, and best of all....I've been using it almost six months, and NOT one single ground is in the pod! I don't know how they accomplished that, as that was an issue with all previous Keurig's, but this machine stays clean! I like it so much, that I might just go buy another to have as a backup for the future:-) A lot of thought went into designing this one! Great job Keurig!

name: Julie
review_text: Love my new Keurig K-Elite Coffee Maker!!! I have used the mini K-15 while visiting and felt as a coffee lover, it is a waste of time. I have personally owned 3-Keurig Classic K 55 coffee makers and have used them hard over the last 18 years. My last maker bought the dust after 5 years of hard use! I purchased the new K-Elite 75 oz  water reservoir and have been using about 1 month now.  It brews a great cup of coffee and actually adds a little froth at the end of brewing if you like expresso. I enjoy the hot water button that works great for instant cereal or cup of soups etc... It also has 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 oz brew sizes. I use the iced coffee and the strong buttons to brew a great cup of iced coffee. My travel mug fits easily under the drip mechanism. All K-cup shaped pods work. If you use your own ground coffee you need to buy the my-K cup pod for a nominal price. The quick start directions allowed me to enjoy a fresh cup within 30 minutes upon arrival.  The "on" timer does not always work unless reset, but pushing a button and having coffee in 2 minutes is okay with me! I am getting used to replacing the lid on the reservoir after filling but it will become second nature as time goes on. I love having my coffee when I want it and it must be fresh! This new model delivers both!!!
